cause.description:
The mission of Telluride Association is to:
* Build character by giving significant responsibilities to talented young people and by requiring them to carry out their responsibilities through democratic processes in a small community.
* Provide outstanding educational opportunities to people while giving them significant responsibilities, with an emphasis on the links between the two.
* Educate young men and women in the ways of critical thinking and democratic self-government-- promoting shared intellectual life--and to allow them to develop and utilize this experience in short- and long-term residential programs.
Telluride also sponsors the following:
* Cornell Branch of Telluride Association (CBTA) and Michigan Branch of Telluride Association (MBTA): Approximately 30 intellectually-talented, and community-minded, Cornell/UMich students are provided with renewable room and board scholarships in the pursuit of Telluride's mission.
* Telluride Association Sophomore Seminar (TASS): Each summer, forty-eight bright, motivated high school sophomores will participate in one of three challenging six-week college-level courses in African American studies and other fields at the University of Michigan and Indiana University.
* Telluride Association Summer Program (TASP): TASP is a six-week educational experience for high school juniors that offers challenges and rewards rarely encountered in secondary school or even college. It's like TASS, but more ethnically/culturally diverse and WAY cooler. Also, it's hosted at 3 different universities (UMich, Cornell, and UT Austin) though there are 4 programs; Cornell has 2.
1. Young men and women should develop critical-thinking skills.
2. Democratic self-governance is important.
3. People have to give back to the community.
cause.mission: Build character, educate talented youth, foster self-governance, and (basically) rock your face off.
cause.name: Support the Education of Talented Youth
